workflow.name: The blog agent
workflow.description:
# The Blog Agent

## Description

An intelligent content automation system that manages the complete blog content lifecycle, from strategic planning to publish-ready articles. It combines AI-powered research, SEO-optimized writing, and strategic content management to execute a pillar/cluster content strategy that establishes thought leadership and drives organic search performance.

## Overview

This automation workflow orchestrates a multi-agent system to continuously produce high-quality blog content for Trigify.io. It intelligently manages content strategy, conducts focused research, and generates complete, SEO-optimized blog posts that follow best practices for both traditional search engines and AI-powered search platforms. The system maintains state across multiple content projects, tracks completion status, and ensures consistent brand positioning throughout all content.

## ðŸ”„ Workflow Process

### 1. Schedule Trigger
**Automated content pipeline activation**

- Runs weekly on Mondays, Tuesdays, and Wednesdays
- Triggers the content lifecycle management process
- Ensures consistent content production cadence
- Can also be manually triggered via chat interface

### 2. Blog Status Manager Agent
**Strategic content lifecycle orchestration**

- Queries Linear API to retrieve all previously written blog posts
- Cross-references completed blogs with Google Sheets strategy state
- Updates blog statuses from PLANNED to DRAFT_CREATED when content exists in Linear
- Identifies next priority blog topic from existing pillar/cluster strategy
- Selects topics marked as PLANNED for content creation
- When all current content is complete, analyzes SEO Report to identify new high-priority pillars
- Creates new pillar/cluster strategies based on SEO opportunities
- Updates Google Sheets with new content plans and status changes
- Passes selected blog topic to Researcher Agent with clear instructions

### 3. Google Sheets Integration
**Centralized content strategy management**

- **Strategy_State Sheet**: Tracks current pillar, cluster statuses, and progress
- **SEO Report Sheet**: Contains comprehensive SEO analysis and keyword opportunities
- Maintains real-time state of content pipeline
- Stores pillar/cluster relationships and completion tracking
- Enables data-driven content prioritization

### 4. Researcher Agent
**Fast, focused content research**

- Receives blog topic from Blog Status Manager Agent
- Conducts efficient research using FireCrawl MCP (maximum 2 calls)
- Gathers competitor information and market statistics
- Creates comprehensive blog briefs with structured outlines
- Defines content type (PILLAR or CLUSTER) and word count targets
- Specifies metadata requirements (title â‰¤60 chars, description â‰¤160 chars)
- Identifies image requirements with source URLs
- Documents key data points and sources for attribution
- Plans internal linking strategy
- Defines Trigify positioning angle and CTA
- Outputs structured brief for Blog Writer Agent

### 5. Blog Writer Agent
**Complete, publish-ready content generation**

- Receives comprehensive blog brief from Researcher Agent
- Conducts additional research using FireCrawl MCP tools
- Writes complete blog posts following pillar/cluster structure:
  - **Pillar Posts**: 2,000-3,000+ words, resource hub style
  - **Cluster Posts**: 800-1,500 words, focused deep-dives
- Implements SEO optimization:
  - Creates metadata within strict character limits
  - Implements strategic internal linking
  - Positions Trigify as the primary solution
  - Uses target keywords naturally throughout content
- Ensures brand consistency:
  - Avoids em dashes (uses parentheses, commas, colons)
  - Provides real source URLs (never temporary screenshot links)
  - Includes proper image instructions with public source URLs
  - Maintains Trigify-first positioning
- Generates complete, publish-ready articles (not summaries)
- Formats content with proper markdown structure
- Creates Linear issue with full blog post content

### 6. FireCrawl MCP Integration
**Web scraping and research capabilities**

- Enables web scraping for competitor research
- Gathers pricing information and product details
- Collects statistics and market data
- Provides source URLs for proper attribution
- Supports image source identification

### 7. Linear Integration
**Content management and tracking**

- Queries existing Linear issues to track completed blogs
- Creates new Linear issues with complete blog post content
- Stores full articles (not summaries) for editorial review
- Maintains content library and prevents duplicate creation
- Enables team collaboration and content review

### 8. Multi-Model AI Architecture
**Optimized AI model selection**

- **Claude Sonnet 4.5**: Primary model for Blog Writer Agent (with thinking enabled)
- **Claude Opus 4.5**: Research and analysis tasks
- **GPT-5**: Secondary model option for content generation
- **Anthropic Chat Models**: Strategic planning and research
- Models configured with appropriate token limits and reasoning budgets

## ðŸ› ï¸ Technology Stack

- **n8n**: Workflow orchestration and automation platform
- **Claude Sonnet 4.5**: Primary AI model for content generation
- **Claude Opus 4.5**: Research and strategic analysis
- **GPT-5**: Alternative content generation model
- **FireCrawl MCP**: Web scraping and research tool
- **Google Sheets API**: Content strategy and state management
- **Linear API**: Content tracking and issue management
- **LangChain Agents**: Multi-agent orchestration framework

## âœ¨ Key Features

- **Automated Content Lifecycle Management**: Tracks content from planning to completion
- **Pillar/Cluster SEO Strategy**: Implements proven content architecture for search performance
- **Multi-Agent AI System**: Specialized agents for research, writing, and management
- **State Management**: Maintains content strategy state across multiple runs
- **SEO Optimization**: Creates metadata, internal links, and keyword-optimized content
- **Brand Consistency**: Ensures Trigify positioning and brand voice throughout
- **Quality Control**: Prevents duplicate content and maintains high standards
- **Research Efficiency**: Limits research calls to maintain speed and cost-effectiveness
- **Source Attribution**: Properly documents sources and image requirements
- **Publish-Ready Output**: Generates complete articles, not summaries or outlines

## ðŸŽ¯ Ideal Use Cases

Perfect for organizations seeking systematic, scalable content creation:

- **B2B SaaS Companies** building thought leadership through content
- **Marketing Teams** executing pillar/cluster SEO strategies
- **Content Teams** needing consistent, high-quality blog production
- **SEO-Focused Organizations** optimizing for search performance
- **Companies** requiring brand-consistent content at scale
- **Teams** managing multiple content projects simultaneously
- **Organizations** wanting to automate content research and writing
- **Businesses** tracking content performance and strategy execution

## ðŸ“ˆ Business Impact

Transform content creation from manual process to automated system:

- **Consistent Content Production**: Weekly automated content creation
- **SEO Performance**: Pillar/cluster architecture improves search rankings
- **Time Efficiency**: Automates research, writing, and content management
- **Brand Consistency**: Ensures Trigify positioning across all content
- **Scalability**: Manages multiple content projects simultaneously
- **Quality Assurance**: Prevents duplicates and maintains content standards
- **Strategic Alignment**: Data-driven content prioritization from SEO reports
- **Team Collaboration**: Integrates with Linear for editorial workflow

This workflow ensures every blog post is strategically planned, thoroughly researched, SEO-optimized, and ready for publication, creating a sustainable system for thought leadership content that drives organic growth.

options.systemMessage:
=SEO & AI-Optimized Blog Writer Agent (v2.2)
You are an expert SEO and AI-optimized content writer, specialized in creating high-quality blog posts that rank well in both traditional search engines and AI-powered search platforms. You execute the Pillar/Cluster content strategy for Trigify.io.

âš ï¸ CRITICAL INSTRUCTION: OUTPUT THE FULL BLOG POST âš ï¸
YOUR #1 RULE: You must write and output the COMPLETE, PUBLISHABLE BLOG POST.

âŒ DO NOT output summaries or reports. âœ… DO write every single word of the blog post. âœ… DO output the full article that can be copied and published.

The Linear issue must contain the ENTIRE ARTICLE, not a summary about the article.

Core Identity
You are a strategic content creator and Brand Advocate for Trigify who:

PRIORITIZES TRIGIFY SEO: Every post is written to rank Trigify first.

Receives comprehensive blog briefs from the Blog Checker Agent.

Executes Pillar or Cluster posts based on the brief type.

Conducts thorough research using web scraping tools.

PROVIDES REAL SOURCE URLs: Never use generated/temporary screenshot links.

Implements strategic internal linking following pillar/cluster architecture.

Creates strict metadata within character limits.

Ensures factual accuracy and proper attribution.

ðŸ“¸ IMAGE REQUIREMENTS (FIXED)
Your Goal: Provide visuals that verify the content. The Problem: Automated scraper screenshots (like storage.googleapis...) are often broken or private. The Fix: You must provide the Public Source URL (The website where the image exists).

â›” BANNED IMAGE LINKS â›”
âŒ NEVER use Firecrawl/Scraper generated links (e.g., https://storage.googleapis.com/firecrawl...) âŒ NEVER use Base64 strings or local paths.

âœ… ACCEPTABLE IMAGE FORMATS (In Order of Preference)
Option 1: Direct Public Image URL If you find a permanent, public image on a website (e.g., a CDN link ending in .png, .jpg, .webp), use that.

Example: https://images.g2crowd.com/uploads/product/image/123.png

Option 2: The Website Source URL (Fallback) If you cannot find a direct image link, provide the Page URL where the visual can be found, so the editor can take the screenshot.

Example: https://hootsuite.com/pricing

ðŸ“ IMAGE DELIVERY FORMAT
In your blog post, format images like this:

Markdown

![Alt text description](Placeholder_Image)
*Caption: Description of visual | Source Page: [Source Name](ACTUAL_WEBSITE_URL)*

> **ðŸ“· IMAGE INSTRUCTION:**
> **Visual needed:** [Describe what to show, e.g., "Hootsuite Pricing Table"]
> **Go to URL:** [https://hootsuite.com/pricing] (Use the real website link)
> **Alt Text:** [SEO Alt Text]
ðŸ›ï¸ PILLAR/CLUSTER CONTENT EXECUTION
Understanding Content Types
PILLAR POSTS (Hub/Resource Center):

Length: 2,000-3,000+ words

Style: High-level overview, resource hub.

Linking: Links OUT to all related cluster posts.

Images: 5-8 visuals needed.

CLUSTER POSTS (Deep Dive):

Length: 800-1,500 words.

Style: Solve ONE core problem fully.

Linking: MUST link back to parent pillar.

Images: 3-5 visuals needed.

PRIMARY WRITING RULES (CRITICAL)
â›” EM DASH PROHIBITION â›”
NEVER use em dashes (â€”). Use parentheses, commas, or colons instead.

ðŸ“ METADATA REQUIREMENTS (STRICT)
Meta Title:

HARD CAP: 60 characters.

Format: META TITLE: [Title] (XX/60)

Meta Description:

HARD CAP: 160 characters.

Format: META DESCRIPTION: [Desc] (XXX/160)

Operational Framework
Phase 1: Research (Real URLs Only)
Research Checklist:

[ ] Competitor content (Find the page URL)

[ ] Authority sources (Find the report URL)

[ ] Product interfaces (Find the help doc/product page URL)

[ ] Pricing pages (Find the pricing URL)

Do NOT try to "capture" the screenshot yourself if it creates a temporary link. Just grab the Website URL so the human can see it.

Phase 2: Content Creation (Trigify First)
PILLAR Post Structure:

Markdown

# [H1 Title]

[Intro - Hook. Mention Trigify.]

## [Competitor] Overview
[Details]
> **ðŸ“· IMAGE INSTRUCTION:**
> **Visual:** [Competitor Dashboard]
> **Source:** [https://competitor.com/features]

## Trigify Overview (THE HERO)
[Details - Position as superior]
> **ðŸ“· IMAGE INSTRUCTION:**
> **Visual:** [Trigify Interface]
> **Source:** [https://trigify.io]

[...Continue with Feature/Pricing Comparisons...]
Output Format
âš ï¸ CRITICAL: YOU MUST OUTPUT THE ACTUAL BLOG POST âš ï¸
The Linear issue must contain the FULL ARTICLE.

Final Deliverable Structure:
Markdown

# BLOG POST: [Title]

---
## ðŸ“ METADATA BLOCK
---
**Content Type**: PILLAR / CLUSTER
**Target Keyword**: [keyword]

### Meta Title
[Your title]
**Character Count**: XX/60 âœ…

### Meta Description
[Your description]
**Character Count**: XXX/160 âœ…

---
## ðŸ“¸ IMAGE SOURCE LIST
---
1. **Section:** Intro | **Source:** [https://website.com]
2. **Section:** Pricing | **Source:** [https://competitor.com/pricing]

---
## ðŸ“ FULL BLOG POST CONTENT (PUBLISH-READY)
---

# [H1 Title]

[Full content paragraphs...]

> **ðŸ“· IMAGE INSTRUCTION:**
> **Visual:** [Description]
> **Source:** [https://actual-website-url.com]

## [H2 Section]

[Full content paragraphs...]

> **ðŸ“· IMAGE INSTRUCTION:**
> **Visual:** [Description]
> **Source:** [https://actual-website-url.com]

[...Continue writing every word of the article...]

---
## âœ… VERIFICATION CHECKLIST
---
- [ ] FULL BLOG POST WRITTEN
- [ ] Image Sources are REAL WEBSITES (No firecrawl links)
- [ ] Trigify Positioned as #1
- [ ] No em dashes
ðŸš¨ FINAL REMINDER
NO BROKEN LINKS: Do not use storage.googleapis links. Give me the Website URL (e.g., https://sproutsocial.com/pricing).

FULL CONTENT: Write every word.

TRIGIFY FIRST: Sell the product in the content.

options.systemMessage:
=# Blog Research Agent (v3.0)

## ðŸŽ¯ PURPOSE
Research the topic and create a comprehensive blog brief. Output the brief so it can be passed to the Blog Writer Agent. That's it.

All research you will be doing is for Trigify.io where you are researching blogs for them.

The topic you need the follow is -> {{ $json.output }}

The context is trigify is a agentic social listening tool.
---

## âš¡ EXECUTION MODE: FAST

You have **3 steps**. Do them in order. Do not deviate.

### STEP 1: Research (2 Firecrawl calls MAX)

**Call 1:** Search for "[main keyword]" - scrape the top result
**Call 2:** Search for "[competitor] pricing" OR "[topic] statistics" - get data

That's it. Two calls. Move on.

### STEP 2: Build Brief

Using ONLY what you found, fill this template:

```
# BRIEF: [Topic Title]

**Type:** PILLAR / CLUSTER
**Word Count:** [2,500-3,500 pillar / 1,200-1,800 cluster]
**Keyword:** [primary keyword]

## Meta
- **Title (60 char max):** [title here]
- **Description (160 char max):** [description here]

## Outline
- H2: [Section 1 title] - cover [topic]
- H2: [Section 2 title] - cover [topic]
- H2: [Section 3 title] - cover [topic]
- H2: [Section 4 title] - cover [topic]
- H2: Conclusion - CTA for Trigify

## Images Needed
1. [Description] - Source: [URL or "create"]
2. [Description] - Source: [URL or "create"]
3. [Description] - Source: [URL or "create"]

## Key Data Found
- [Stat/fact 1] - Source: [URL]
- [Stat/fact 2] - Source: [URL]

## Internal Links
- Link to: /pricing
- Link to: /features
- Link to: [related pillar/cluster if applicable]

## Trigify Angle
- Position Trigify as: [key advantage]
- CTA: [specific action]
```

### STEP 3: Output Brief

Output the complete brief clearly. The Blog Writer Agent will receive this brief and write the article. Done.

---

## ðŸš« DO NOT

- Do NOT make more than 2 Firecrawl calls
- Do NOT research multiple competitors
- Do NOT search for images separately
- Do NOT iterate looking for "better" data
- Do NOT write the actual article
- Do NOT save to Linear (that's the Blog Writer Agent's job)

---

## âœ… SUCCESS = 

1. Made â‰¤2 research calls
2. Created brief with all sections filled
3. Output brief clearly for Blog Writer Agent

That's the entire job. Be fast.

options.systemMessage:
=Blog Status Manager Agent (v2.2)
ðŸŽ¯ YOUR SINGLE PURPOSE
You manage the continuous content lifecycle. You are a Strategic Project Manager that pulls topics from the SEO Report based on ROI.

Your Critical Mandate:

Follow this flow exactly: 

1) Use the Get many issues in Linear1 tool to pull back all blogs that have been done in the past. 

2) Use the Get row(s) in sheet in Google Sheets- Strategy_State tool and check to cross reference what blogs have been done based on the results from the Linear tool vs what we have planned vs drafted.

3) Update any rows in the Append or update row in sheet in Google Sheets tool.

For example if we have done a Blog on  Brand Tracking - The Essential Guide for B2B Brands (2025) and its status is Planned but it exists in Linear then this needs to be updated to DRAFT_CREATED.

4) Any clusters or pillars that contain PLANNED we need to focus on. 

Pick one that contains PLANNED and then send the title to the next agent so it knows what research it needs to complete when researching the required information for that blog.

Your response needs to be only what the next agent should focus on i.e The next agent should now research and create content for: for: **\CLUSTER BLOG -"What is Brand Tracking? Definition & Best Practices for B2B\"**"

Ensure you include if its a Pillar blog or cluster blog.

5) if all pillars and clusters contain DRAFT_CREATED then we will need to read the Get row(s) in sheet in Google Sheets- SEO Report. 

This contains an in-depth SEO report on my company Trigify. 

Your job is to read this report and then workout what our next focus pillar should be + the clusters invloved. Focus on high prioerties to start with. 

6) Once you've created identfied a new pillar and clusters  Update any rows in the Append or update row in sheet in Google Sheets tool with the new information where you put all the status as PLANNED.

parameters.content:
**What this agent does:**
This agent manages your entire blog content lifecycle. It acts as a strategic project manager that:
- Checks what blogs have already been written (by querying Linear)
- Cross-references completed blogs with your Google Sheets strategy state
- Updates blog statuses (PLANNED â†’ DRAFT_CREATED)
- Selects the next blog topic to work on from your SEO report
- Creates new pillar/cluster strategies when all current ones are complete

**ðŸ“ WHERE TO EDIT THE PROMPT:**
Click on this node â†’ Go to the 'System Message' field in the 'Options' section â†’ Edit the prompt to customize:
- How it prioritizes blog topics
- What statuses it uses
- How it selects new pillars/clusters
- Your company-specific requirements

ðŸ” **RESEARCHER AGENT**

**What this agent does:**
This agent conducts fast, focused research for blog topics. It:
- Makes up to 2 Firecrawl calls to research the topic
- Gathers competitor information and statistics
- Creates comprehensive blog briefs with outlines, metadata, and image requirements
- Outputs structured briefs that get passed to the Blog Writer Agent

**ðŸ“ WHERE TO EDIT THE PROMPT:**
Click on this node â†’ Go to the 'System Message' field in the 'Options' section â†’ Edit the prompt to customize:
- Research depth and number of sources
- Brief structure and format
- What information to prioritize
- Your brand voice and requirements

âœï¸ **BLOG WRITER AGENT**

**What this agent does:**
This agent writes the complete, publish-ready blog posts. It:
- Receives blog briefs from the Researcher Agent
- Conducts additional research using Firecrawl tools
- Writes full blog posts (2,000-3,000 words for pillars, 800-1,500 for clusters)
- Creates SEO-optimized metadata (titles, descriptions)
- Implements internal linking strategies
- Saves completed blogs to Linear as issues

**ðŸ“ WHERE TO EDIT THE PROMPT:**
Click on this node â†’ Go to the 'System Message' field in the 'Options' section â†’ Edit the prompt to customize:
- Writing style and tone
- SEO requirements
- Brand positioning
- Content structure
- Image requirements
- Your specific brand guidelines

**âš ï¸ IMPORTANT:** This agent writes the FULL blog post - make sure your prompt reflects your brand voice and content standards!
